TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit VirtualizationCacheLength extends System.ValueType implements class System.IEquatable`1<valuetype System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLength>

Docs.summary: Represents the measurements for the attached property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength%2A?displayProperty=fullName> attached property specifies the amount of space in which a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel> virtualizes the items before or after the view port (the area in which items are visible). You can specify uniform cache length my creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLength> by using the constructor that takes a single parameter. You can use the constructor that takes two parameters to specify different values for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLength.CacheBeforeViewport%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLength.CacheAfterViewport%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public VirtualizationCacheLength (double cacheBeforeAndAfterViewport);

Docs.param: The size of the cache before and after the viewport.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with a uniform cache length for each side of the viewport.

MemberSignature.Value: public VirtualizationCacheLength (double cacheBeforeViewport, double cacheAfterViewport);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float64 cacheBeforeViewport, float64 cacheAfterViewport) cil managed

Docs.param: The size of the cache before the viewport.
The size of the cache after the viewport.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class with the specified cache lengths for each side of the viewport.

MemberSignature.Value: public double CacheAfterViewport { get; }
.property instance float64 CacheAfterViewport

Docs.summary: Gets the size of the cache before the viewport when the is virtualizing.
Docs.value: The size of the cache after the viewport when the is virtualizing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In this context, "virtualize" refers to a technique by which a subset of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] elements are generated from a larger number of data items based on which items are visible on the screen. Use a cache to avoid generating [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] elements as they’re scrolled into view.

Docs.value: The size of the cache after the viewport when the is virtualizing.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In this context, "virtualize" refers to a technique by which a subset of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] elements are generated from a larger number of data items based on which items are visible on the screen. Use a cache to avoid generating [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] elements as they’re scrolled into view.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLength> checks for value equality. That is, the two objects are equal if their <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLength.CacheBeforeViewport%2A> property values are equal and their <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLength.CacheAfterViewport%2A> property values are equal.
